<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module8_mcq_q89')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">A company has a perpetual debt of $80 million at an interest rate of 8% and faces a corporate tax rate of 25%. What is the present value of its annual interest tax shield?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q89" value="A"> A. $4 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q89" value="B"> B. $6 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q89" value="C"> C. $8 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q89" value="D"> D. $20 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q89" value="E"> E. $25 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module8_mcq_q89" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: D.  
Annual interest = 0.08 × 80 = 6.4 million.  
Annual tax shield = 6.4 × 0.25 = 1.6 million.  
Since the debt is perpetual, the present value of the tax shield is $1.6 / 0.08 = **$20 million**.
</div>

:::
